Title: JYP Entertainment's New Girl Group NMIXX Confirms Official Debut Date
Content: JYP Entertainmentâ€™s upcoming girl group NMIXX has confirmed their official debut for February 22. In the teaser poster, seven silhouettes catch the eye with a jellyfish swimming over them, raising curiosity. Their debut single, AD MARE, is the latin phrase meaning â€œtowards the seaâ€.Â  NMIXX consists of seven members and the group name has the meaning of combining the letter â€œNâ€, which stands for now, new, next, and the unknown n, and the word â€œmixâ€, which symbolizes combination and diversity. Stay tuned for their debut single release on February 22 at 6 PM KST.Â

Title: The 2021 Fourth Quarter Revenues For The "Big 4" K-Pop Companies Reached An Insane Amount
Content: As weâ€™re now in the first quarter of 2022, experts have had the time to calculate the total revenues made by the â€œBig 4â€ Korean entertainment companies in the fourth quarter of 2021:Â HYBE Labels,Â SM Entertainment,Â YG Entertainment, andÂ JYP Entertainment. Overall, their total revenue together came to an incredible 730.7 billion KRW (or ~607 million USD)! Here is how much each company made, from lowest to highest revenue, between October and December 2021. | BigHit Entertainment Out of the â€œBig 4â€ companies, the one that made the least revenue (but still an extremely impressive amount) for the last quarter of 2021 isÂ JYP Entertainment.  The total amount that they made during this time wasÂ 58.4 billion KRW (~ 48.5 million USD).Â Stray Kids came out as the companyâ€™s biggest source of revenue in the year thanks to their million+ sales ofÂ NOEASY, butÂ TWICE andÂ ITZY both made large contributions as well! Going into 2022, the companyâ€™s new artistsÂ Xdinary Heroes andÂ NMIXX, along with the debut team members of SBSâ€™s audition programÂ Loud, are expected to bring in high revenue. | JYP Entertainment Coming in third place for the highest revenue for the last quarter of last year isÂ YG Entertainment!  The total amount that they made during this time wasÂ 77.2 billion KRW (~Â 64.2 million USD). While this is less than the other two companies on this list, itâ€™s still nothing to scoff at, especially considering that the only major releases that came out in the fourth quarter were fromÂ Mino andÂ Kang Seungyoon. For 2022, it looks like YG Entertainment is already planning several big releases fromÂ TREASURE,Â BLACKPINK, andÂ WINNER, along with a new girl group, and together theyâ€™ll certainly bring in the cash! | YG Entertainment The company to make the second-highest amount in revenue for the final quarter of 2021 isÂ SM Entertainment.  The total amount that they made during this time wasÂ 192.7 billion KRW (~Â 160.2 million USD). The company had a number of major comebacks in the last quarter, namely fromÂ NCT 127,Â aespa,Â Kai, andÂ Super Junior D&E, all of which contributed to the 4+ million albums sold in that time. Moving into 2022, it sounds like SM Entertainment is planning to expand their ventures into new territory, including NFTs. | SM Entertainment And finally, the Korean entertainment company that made the highest revenue in the fourth quarter of 2021 isÂ HYBE Labels!  The total amount that they made during this time wasÂ 402.4 billion KRW (~Â 334.5 million USD). This was the highest-earning quarter of 2021 for the company, due mostly to album releases byÂ SEVENTEEN andÂ ENHYPEN (who sold around 4.77 million units). Thanks to this high number, HYBE Labels is likely going to reach the 1 trillion KRW milestone for total sales in 2021! The companyâ€™s plans for 2022 includeÂ BTSâ€˜sÂ Permission To Dance On Stage concert in Seoul, as well as the launch ofÂ Weverse 2.0 and a dive into the NFT market.

Title: JYP Entertainment's Upcoming Girl Group Finally Announces Their New Name And Logo Ahead Of Debut
Content: Last year, JYP Entertainment had fans very excited when they announced that a new girl group would be debuting in 2022. They also revealed that the â€œBlind Packageâ€ will be a limited edition of their new girl groupâ€™s debut single. It would include a limited-edition CD, photobook, photocard, poster, polaroid, and more. Needless to say, the news had fans extremely excited!  As the months passed, the company started to share more about the girl group and started releasing content under the name JYPn!  Soon after, all seven members were announced through videos showcasing their true talents. Yet, if netizens thought it would be a group of unknown trainees, they couldnâ€™t have been more wrong. The members included some familiar names from the very beginning, including long-time JYP trainee and highly anticipated idol Lily Mâ€¦ Your browser does not support video.| JYPn/ YouTubeÂ Â  To Sullyoon, who gained attention for being accepted by all of the â€œBig 3â€ K-Pop agenciesâ€¦ Your browser does not support video.| JYPn/ YouTube  And those who netizens have seen in other music videos, such as Jinni who is assumed to be a member of the groupâ€™s dance line. She joins the rest of the members, including BAE, Haewoon, Kyujin, and Jiwoo. Your browser does not support video.| JYPn/ YouTube  Although the name seemed perfect for the group, many doubted that it would be the final name of the group as it seemed too much like a rookie name. Yet, after a lot of waiting, JYP Entertainment has released the newest name of the group and their logo. Back in September, netizens noticed that JYP had trademarked a new name, and the company has officially announced through a special teaser that their new girl group will be calledÂ NMIXX. Your browser does not support video.| JYP Entertainment/ YouTubeÂ  It seems like the trademark registration put through on September 13 actually was a spoiler and proved that the company hadÂ revealed the true name of JYP Entertainmentâ€™s new girl group back in 2021. | KIPRIS  When the name was first brought up with netizens, many focused on the letter â€œNâ€ and saw that it was very similar toÂ 6MIX. 6MIX was the original name for the pre-debut JYP Entertainment group that preceded TWICE, consisting ofÂ Jihyo,Â Jeongyeon,Â Sana, andÂ Nayeon,Â along with two other trainees.Â  (Left to right) TWICEâ€™s Jihyo, Jeongyeon, Sana, and Nayeon | Mnet  It was also announced that SQU4D would manage the group. SQU4D is the newest artistsâ€™ division and is led by director Lee Jiyoung, known for discovering members of 2PM and Wonder Girls. Since the news was announced, the group has released its new social media accounts for fans to follow, and it definitely has fans excited! Title: Possible Logo For JYP Entertainment's New Girl Group Revealed
Content: Earlier this week, a possible final name for JYP Entertainmentâ€˜s upcoming girl groupâ€”currently known as JYPnâ€”was revealed through a recent trademark application. Now, thereâ€™s a trademark for the logo too. Less than three years since ITZY debuted, JYP Entertainment is already gearing up to debut a new girl group. So far, four members have been revealed: 15-year-old Kyujin, JYPnâ€™s Kyujin (center) and Jinni (right) | @JYPn_official/Twitter 16-year-old Jiwoo, JYPnâ€™s Jiwoo | @JYPn_official/Twitter 17-year-old Jinni, JYPnâ€™s Jinni | @JYPn_official/Twitter and 17-year-old Sullyoon. JYPnâ€™s Sullyoon | @JYPn_official/Twitter Currently, the group is known as JYPnâ€”the â€œnâ€ standing for next, new, now, and unknown according to JYP Entertainment. However, the company has also revealed that JYPn wonâ€™t be the girl groupâ€™s final name. JYPnâ€™s Jinni, Kyujin, and Jiwoo | JYPn/YouTube After rumors circulated that the group could be called SQU4D, Neora, Xdinary Heroes, or Cherryz, a new possible name has surfaced thatâ€™s much more likely than the previous contenders. On September 13, JYP Entertainment registered a new trademark under the name NMIXX. | KIPRIS Alongside including the letter â€œNâ€ just like JYPn, NMIXX is also similar the 6MIXâ€”the name several TWICE members were originally going to debut with. While thereâ€™s no guarantee that NMIXX was trademarked for the new girl group, it definitely seems like a likely candidate. And now, the name has a logo too: | JYP Entertainment On September 14, JYP Entertainment registered a new set of five logo trademarks, all with a distinctive wordmark spelling out NMIXX. Both the logo and name trademarks are registered under the same classifications typically used for K-Pop groups, such as Category 41 â€“ Entertainment. | KIPRIS Designed in a modern, condensed geometric font, the NMIXX logo has edgy and futuristic vibes that could be indicative of the girl groupâ€™s upcoming concept.  Just like the name NMIXX itself, fans across social media are sharing mixed opinions on the logo. Some instantly fell in love, while others have expressed that they hope it grows on them eventually. Ultimately, thereâ€™s still no telling whether NMIXX is really the final name for JYPn, but hopefully, fans wonâ€™t have to wait too long to find out.

Title: Final Name Of JYP's New Girl Group Possibly Leaked Through New Trademark Registration
Content: While JYP Entertainmentâ€˜s upcoming girl group is currently known as JYPn, thatâ€™s not actually the name theyâ€™ll debut with. Up until now, thereâ€™s been no sign of an official name reveal for the JYPn projectâ€”but it may have been leaked in a recent trademark application. JYPn is the project name for JYP Entertainmentâ€™s first new girl group since ITZY debuted around two and a half years ago. Currently, the group has four members revealed: 17-year-old Sullyoon, JYPnâ€™s Sullyoon | @JYPn_official/Twitter 17-year-old Jinni, JYPnâ€™s Jinni | @JYPn_official/Twitter 16-year-old Jiwoo, JYPnâ€™s Jiwoo | @JYPn_official/Twitter and 15-year-old Kyujin. JYPnâ€™s Kyujin (center) and Jinni (right) | @JYPn_official/Twitter According to press releases, the pre-debut name JYPn was chosen to represent multiple meanings: â€œnext,â€ â€œnow,â€ â€œnew,â€ and â€œnâ€ itself, which is typically used to represent an unknown number or factor. JYPnâ€™s Jinni, Kyujin, and Jiwoo | JYPn/YouTube Since the group was announced, many name rumors have circulated among early fans. At first, it was believed that JYPn would officially be named SQU4D, indicating a possible four-member group. However, it was later revealed that SQU4D is the name of JYP Entertainmentâ€™s â€œDivision 4,â€ the side of the company expected to manage the new girl group. Other speculated names included Neora (a combination of â€œneo,â€ meaning new, and â€œeraâ€), Xdinary Heroes (a shortened version of â€œextraordinary heroesâ€), and Cherryz (a name which has been circulating since just months after ITZYâ€™s debut). JYPnâ€™s Sullyoon | JYPn/YouTube But now, a new trademark registration may have revealed the true name of JYP Entertainmentâ€™s new girl group. On September 13, the company applied for a new trademark under the name NMIXX. | KIPRIS At first glance, given the focus on the letter â€œN,â€ NMIXX definitely looks like it could be a possible name for JYPn. On top of that, itâ€™s also very similar to 6MIX. 6MIX was the original name for the pre-debut JYP Entertainment group that preceded TWICE, consisting of Jihyo, Jeongyeon, Sana, and Nayeon along with two other trainees. First planned to debut around 2014 or 2015, the team was â€œdisbandedâ€ ahead of SIXTEEN and TWICE eventually took its place. (Left to right) TWICEâ€™s Jihyo, Jeongyeon, Sana, and Nayeon | Mnet On top of the trademark, fans have also uncovered a Twitter account under the name @NMIXX_official, created in the same month as the official JYPn Twitter. However, Twitter allows users to change their names at any time, which means that itâ€™s possible a fan claimed the username after the NMIXX trademark was revealed. well then â€¦. NMIXX YOUR NEXT FAVORITE GIRL GROUP  both accounts were made in May 2021#JYPn #NMIXX pic.twitter.com/B1EkSbio5p â€” ğŸ’ (@jinnigenie) September 15, 2021  That aside, another possible clue could be JYPnâ€™s current logo. JYPnâ€™s logo | JYP Entertainment Look closely, and youâ€™ll notice that all the letters in NMIXX can be seen in the formation. Your browser does not support video. Currently, the trademark is only registered under the categories for cosmetics and perfumes, digital media like CDs, and jewelryâ€”classifications often used for trademarked merchandise. K-Pop group names are often usually registered under the classifications for business and entertainment too. However, itâ€™s not uncommon for companies to apply for trademarks in these categories at a later date. Itâ€™s also interesting to note that trademark registrations were how ITZYâ€™s name was first leaked to the public around four months before their debut. ITZY | JYP Entertainment All in all, while thereâ€™s no guarantee that NMIXX was trademarked for JYPn, it definitely seems like a believable fit. Meanwhile, fans are divided on the name itself. While some think NMIXX will fit the group well, others prefer the previously speculated names. That said, group names like ITZYâ€”which are well-loved todayâ€”were originally met with mixed opinions too. With JYPn expected to debut in the first half of 2022, it may not be long until official name confirmation drops.
